work.description: Full-stack web development, working on IBM's XPages platform (a JSF based runtime with baked in NoSQL db) and Node.js. Primary development and support for in-house custom document control system, single-handedly developed a productivity and performance tracking and forecasting system. Other projects and custom web apps developed in-house for other departments, as-needed. Additionally implemented source control solution and custom build process to implement a new CI solution, easing deployment concerns.

Responsible for overseeing the support, maintenance, man hour logging, repair processing, parts ordering and distribution for all mission critical equipment in the Battalion. The operational readiness of the Battalion is calculated from equipment and personnel functionality, we make them happen. Constant review and reporting of equipment status to provide the best support possible to the Battalion Commander, subordinate commanders, and fellow staff sections.

Battalion Staff officer in the role of Supply and Logistics for the 457th Transportation Battalion. Managing of all Battalion owned material, oversight of supply management, and support planning for all organizational operations. Provide support and guidance to Battalion Commander, subordinate commanders, and all staff.

American Heart Association BLS instructor. Provide CPR, First Aid, and AED instruction and testing for the city as a certified AHA BLS instructor. Provide instructional services for new and returning students including skills testing and grading written examinations. Instruction given to both novice (Heartsaver) and Health Care Professional students. Incorporate additional information from cyclical information pushes from the AHA.

Provide emergency care and transport for the community's sick and injured, maintain national and state certifications through continuing education.Primary BLS care provider and ALS crew member. Advanced protocols for above national and state (MN) certification performance. Fully qualified emergency vehicle operator.

Charged with the mission for and care of a 40 man Platoon, equipment operational readiness, and training. Recently returned from a tour in OIF in a line haul Transportation Company, conducting numerous combat support missions, delivering all classes of supply over the country of Iraq. On return stateside, platoon leader for platoon needing the most team reconstruction. Served additional duties of Voting Assistance Officer, Safety Officer, Health Officer and Executive Officer.
Computer systems repair and maintenance, database and networking setup and repair. Specializing in:
descripList: On-Site Service Calls with personal and corporate customers
System Restoration, Virus and Malware removal

description: The Management Information Systems degree provides information that is needed to manage organizations efficiently and effectively. Management Information Systems are not only computer systems - these systems encompass three primary components: technology, people (individuals, groups, or organizations), and data/information for decision making. Management Information Systems are distinct from other Information Systems in that they are designed to be used to analyze and facilitate strategic and operational activities in the organization.

Emphasis in systems architecture and software development were added in all MIS electives, for a unique personal flavor. Served as team leader for senior capstone class project, culminating in a usability study and development of a departmental, mobile usability "lab" with documentation for continued use by others.

Successful completion of a 120 hour NREMT accredited course, successful pass of a written cognitive test and practical exam. Course includes a minimum clinical hours in emergency department and patient interactions in emergency, EMS setting, in "ride along" status. Critical thinking skills, memorization and practical application of medical information and practices, communication skills, and improvisation are all key to success.
Additionally certified with Minnesota's EMSRB (2009-current) and licensed in Wisconsin (2011-current).

entries.what: Eagle Scout, Boy Scouts of America
Iraqi and Afghanistan Veteran's Assocation, lifetime member
EMT certification through NREMT and MN-EMSRB
American Heart Association - CPR and First Aid Instructor (BLS)

interests: Photography, biking, skiing, and snow shoeing are my hobbies. They usually require the outdoors and are great ways to pass time and be active while engaging the brain and creative processes.
